title: Accumulated Gestures
description: A sculptural work made from accumulated paper fragments, exploring how small daily actions compound into substantial physical presence over time.
projectDescription: An ongoing sculptural practice investigating how everyday materials can be transformed through repetitive actions and accumulated time into objects that carry the weight of process and duration.
medium: Compressed paper fragments, wheat paste binder

images.alt: Sculptural object made of compressed layered paper with organic, rock-like form
images.caption: Accumulated Gestures - showing the dense, stratified surface created through months of daily additions

images.alt: Side view showing the layered construction and varied surface textures
images.caption: Side view revealing the archaeological layers of accumulated material

images.alt: Hands adding small paper fragments to the growing sculpture
images.caption: Daily process - adding small fragments each morning as part of studio routine

images.alt: The sculpture displayed in studio setting with natural lighting
images.caption: The finished piece in the studio, showing how it relates to the daily workspace

processNotes: This piece was built through a daily practice over 6 months - every morning I would add 3-5 small paper fragments from the previous day's work. The form emerged organically as the weight of accumulated material found its own structural logic.
inspiration: Geological stratification and the way sedimentary rocks hold time visible in their layers. Also influenced by Richard Long's daily walks and how repeated actions can create substantial artistic statements.
technicalNotes: The wheat paste binder was applied only to every 10th layer, allowing most of the material to maintain its original texture while providing just enough structural integrity. The natural pigments were added irregularly to create temporal markers.
